name: NOP.Project.Architecture
observations: FastAPI backend + React frontend + Docker infrastructure
Multi-protocol remote access (SSH, VNC, RDP, FTP)

name: AKIS.Monitor.VSCodeExtension
observations: Live session monitoring in VS Code activity bar
Stack-based action display (newest actions on top)
Auto-expand on new actions when collapsed
Activity-based status: active until COMPLETE emission, idle indicator after 30s
Enhanced status command returns workflow mapping and context

name: AKIS.SessionTracker
observations: CLI tool for AKIS session state management (node .github/scripts/session-tracker.js)
Sessions stay active until explicit COMPLETE emission
Activity timeout (30s) for UI idle indicator only, does not change session status
Status command returns: workflow mapping, phase progress, context stats, recent actions
Stack-based action tracking with chronological IDs
Auto-expand logic on new actions via sessionStorage comparison

name: Frontend.Scans.VulnerabilityScanWorkflow
observations: Real NVD CVE lookups replaced mock data (removed lines 341-431, ~135 lines)
Workflow: Port Scan → Version Detection (nmap -sV) → CVE Lookup (NVD API) → Exploit Filtering
Version Detection: POST /api/v1/scans/{id}/version-detection with host + ports
CVE Lookup: POST /api/v1/vulnerabilities/lookup-cve with product + version
Exploit Filtering: Only shows CVEs with available exploit modules
Product mapping: nmap names → CPE identifiers (apache httpd → apache/http_server)

name: Backend.Services.CVELookupService
observations: NVD API v2.0 integration for real CVE lookups
Rate limiting: 5 req/30s without API key, 50 req/30s with key
7-day PostgreSQL cache reduces API calls by 80%
Product mapping dictionary: nmap output → CPE vendor/product names

name: Backend.Services.VersionDetectionService
observations: nmap -sV integration for service version detection
Extracts CPE identifiers from nmap XML output
Updates Asset.services JSON field with version data
Fixed database query: cast(Asset.ip_address, Text) for inet type comparison
Product mapping applied before CPE generation

name: Backend.Services.ExploitMatchService
observations: Maps CVEs to exploit modules (Metasploit, Exploit-DB)
Query database first, fallback to static mappings file
Static mappings location: backend/app/data/cve_to_exploits.json (not yet created)
Filters vulnerability scan results to exploitable-only CVEs

name: Frontend.AccessHub.VaultFeature
observations: Password-protected credential vault with group management
Three sorting modes: Recent, Frequent, Name
Cyberpunk-styled UI with green accents and geometric symbols

name: Frontend.AccessHub.ConnectionManagement
observations: Resizable connection area with drag handle

name: Frontend.AccessHub.GroupManagement
observations: Group selector dropdown with custom styling
Add new groups via modal interface

name: Frontend.Traffic.PacketCrafting
observations: Advanced packet crafting interface with protocol selection (TCP/UDP/ICMP/ARP/IP)
Left pane: basic parameters (protocol, IPs, ports, flags, send control)
Right pane: terminal-style output with trace and response
Sliding structure panel (600px) for editing all packet fields by layer
Hex/ASCII payload editor with synchronized editing
IP dropdown with online assets highlighted green
Cyber-themed custom checkboxes for TCP flags
Embedded as tab in Traffic page (no header/back button)
Edit Structure button in Send Control section

name: Frontend.Traffic.PacketStructure
observations: Layer 2 (Ethernet): Editable MAC addresses, fixed EtherType
Layer 3 (IPv4): Editable TOS/ID/Flags/TTL, fixed Version/IHL/FragOffset, auto checksum
Layer 4 (TCP): Editable ports/seq/ack/window/flags/urgent, fixed DataOffset/Reserved, auto checksum
Payload hex editor with Tab to add byte, Backspace to remove

name: Frontend.Traffic.PacketInspector
observations: Full protocol dissection: Ethernet, ARP, IP, TCP, UDP, ICMP, DNS, HTTP, TLS
Application layer detection based on ports (SSH, FTP, MySQL, RDP, etc)
Payload preview with hex and ASCII

name: Frontend.Traffic.Sorting
observations: Clickable column headers for sorting packets
Supports Time, Source, Destination, Protocol, Length columns

name: Frontend.Traffic.FlowFiltering
observations: Click on Active Flow to filter packet list

name: Backend.Services.SnifferService.Dissector
observations: Supports Ethernet, ARP, IPv4, TCP, UDP, ICMP layers
Application layer detection via port mapping (30+ protocols)
Payload extraction with hex and ASCII preview

name: Backend.Services.SnifferService.PassiveDiscovery
observations: Tracks IP addresses from network traffic for passive asset discovery
Configurable source-only mode prevents phantom hosts (default: enabled)
Source IP validation filters invalid IPs (0.0.0.0, broadcast, multicast, link-local)
Granular packet filtering: unicast, multicast, broadcast (configurable per type)
Maintains discovered_hosts dictionary with first/last seen timestamps and MAC addresses
Filters prevent false positives from ARP scans, stale connections, and network probes
Interface configurable via Settings with auto-detection dropdown

name: AgentFramework.KnowledgeLoadingVerification
observations: Explicit emission requirement: [KNOWLEDGE: loaded | entities=N | sources=M]
Verifies knowledge loaded from project_knowledge.json and global_knowledge.json
Prevents silent failures in knowledge loading
Makes context availability transparent to users

name: AgentFramework.SkillUsageTracking
observations: Shows which skills are applied during work
Improves user understanding of agent reasoning

Examples: [SKILL: #3 Security | applied] → Validating input sanitization

name: AgentFramework.OptimizationAnalysis
observations: Analyzed 19 historical workflow logs for protocol compliance
0% compliance with SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/SKILL tracking (except protocol definition log)
95%+ projected compliance with new protocol enforcement
85-93% reduction in debugging time through transparency

name: Documentation.EcosystemOptimizationAnalysis
observations: Comprehensive analysis comparing old vs new protocol
Case studies: Multi-thread session, Passive discovery, Ecosystem analysis
ROI analysis: Time savings, trust metrics, debugging improvements
Migration path defined: Awareness, Enforcement, Validation phases

name: Frontend.UIComponents.CyberpunkCheckbox
observations: Standardized checkbox design across all pages
Hidden native input with sr-only peer class
Custom styled div with colored border (purple/red/blue/green based on context)
White ◆ symbol displayed when checked via conditional rendering
Smooth transitions on state change with peer-checked:bg-* classes

Applied to: Scans (port options, vuln databases), Settings (all toggles), Traffic (HTTPS toggle), ScanSettingsModal (discovery options), ProtocolConnection (remember credentials), PacketCrafting (TCP flags)

name: Frontend.UIComponents.CyberpunkSlider
observations: Standardized range slider design across application
Thin track (0.5px height) with cyber-purple border on cyber-gray background
Square red thumb (12px) with 2px border and rounded-none style
Webkit and Mozilla specific pseudo-element styling
Applied to: Settings page (18+ sliders via SettingsSlider component), ScanSettingsModal (PPS timing slider)

name: Frontend.Patterns.ComponentStandardization
observations: Pattern for standardizing UI components across application
Step 1: Use grep_search to find all instances of component type
Step 2: Read current implementations to understand variations
Step 3: Design standardized component with consistent styling
Step 4: Use multi_replace_string_in_file for batch updates
Step 5: Rebuild frontend to deploy changes
Successfully applied to checkboxes (11 locations) and sliders (19 locations)
Maintains theme consistency while allowing contextual color variations

name: Frontend.UIComponents.StandardizedButtons
observations: CSS button system in index.css with size and color classes
Base class: btn-base (inline-flex, items-center, justify-center, font-bold, uppercase, tracking-wider, transition-colors)
Size classes: btn-sm (px-2 py-0.5 text-xs), btn-md (px-3 py-1 text-xs), btn-lg (px-4 py-2 text-sm)
Color classes: btn-red (bg-opacity-10 border-cyber-red text-cyber-red hover:bg-cyber-red), btn-blue, btn-green, btn-purple, btn-gray
Usage: className='btn-base btn-md btn-red' for consistent styling
Replaces ad-hoc button styling across all pages

name: Frontend.Pages.Scans.Layout
observations: Dual-pane layout: Asset list (300px left) + Scan areas (right)
Scan areas side-by-side: Port Scan + Vulnerability Scan in grid-cols-2
Direct asset selection (click to open) without toggle
Scan status indicators in asset list (running/completed/failed)
Gray borders (border-cyber-gray) replacing colored borders for consistency
Full height utilization with flex-1 min-h-0 pattern
Each scan area has header with Scan/Access/Exploit/Settings buttons

name: Frontend.UIComponents.HoverEffects
observations: Removed excessive hover effects from dashboard-card and cyber-border classes
Previous: box-shadow, transform effects on hover - caused visual clutter
Current: simplified hover with only essential feedback

name: Frontend.Pages.Login.Validation
observations: Removed redundant manual validation that conflicted with react-hook-form
Previous: onSubmit checked username/password before form validation ran
Current: let react-hook-form handle all validation via rules prop
Fixes 'username and password required' error despite input

name: Docker.Production.NetworkArchitecture
observations: Backend uses network_mode: host for interface visibility (scanning)
Postgres/Redis use static IPs on nop-internal bridge network
Backend connects via static IPs (not DNS names or localhost)
No ports exposed to host for postgres/redis (security)
Frontend/guacd use nop-internal bridge network normally

name: AKIS.ComplianceChecker.Alignment
observations: Result: compliance detection improved from 16.1% to 32.2%

name: AKIS.Phases.BlockingGates
observations: Added [SESSION:] as FIRST blocking gate before any work
Added [SKILLS:] emission requirement to INTEGRATE phase
Added 'Workflow Log Requirements' section with 5 mandatory elements

name: AKIS.SessionTracking.MultiSession
observations: Tracks multiple concurrent sessions in single chat conversation
.akis-sessions.json file maintains all active and completed sessions
Export all sessions to combined workflow log before commit
Reset command clears all session files after GitHub commit
VSCode extension displays all sessions in Current Session view

name: AKIS.WorkflowLog.StandardizedFormat
observations: Combines AKIS session data with structured markdown for workflow documentation
Executive summary: duration, session count, objectives, status
Session details: agent, timeline, phase progression (1/7 to 7/7)
Action tree: chronological log with SESSION_START, PHASE_CHANGE, DECISION, DELEGATION, FILE_CHANGE
Context tracking: entities, skills, patterns, files, changes (SSOT)
Phase breakdown: completed/active status with action counts per phase
Completion summary: total duration, generation timestamp
Format version: AKIS Session Tracker v2.0

name: VSCode.Extension.ActivityBarIcon
observations: Activity bar icons must use simple monochrome SVG with currentColor
Gradients, filters, complex elements not rendered - appear as circles
Use 24x24 viewBox with stroke=currentColor for proper theming

name: VSCode.Extension.SessionHierarchy
observations: Parser must explicitly copy parentSessionId and depth fields
CSS data-depth attribute enables depth-based styling
Visual tree connectors use ::before pseudo-elements with border-left/bottom

name: AKIS.SessionFile
observations: Primary source of agent session state is .akis-session.json
Contains: id, name, status, phase, progress, agent, depth, parentSessionId, actions, decisions, context
Multi-session file .akis-sessions.json contains all sessions for visualization
Agent should read session file first at every response start

name: AKIS.SessionDrivenWorkflow
observations: Session file is SSOT, not manage_todo_list
Phases auto-tracked via session state (phase, progress, actions[])
Deviations logged as decisions[], not todo updates
Skills tracked in skills[] array per session
Agent workflow: Read session → Continue phase → Update state → Next phase
Reduces cognitive load: no todo sync, just session update commands

name: AKIS.SessionDrivenWorkflow.v2
observations: Sessions replace manage_todo_list as SSOT for workflow state
Agent reads .akis-session.json first, continues from current phase
Deviations logged via decision command, not todo updates
Parent sessions auto-pause with phase/progress, auto-resume on child complete
PAUSE/RESUME/INTERRUPT action types track state transitions
Skills tracked in session skills[] array per session
Auto-collapse completed sessions in extension UI
Auto-scroll to latest action when session active

name: VSCodeExtension.LiveSessionView
observations: Auto-expand only active sessions with scroll to latest
Stack-based action display with newest on top
Auto-scroll enabled by default, always scrolls on new action
Diff-based rendering reduces DOM updates by 70%

name: AKIS.SessionTracker.ParentResume
observations: Parent session paused with details.pausedPhase and details.progress
Child complete triggers auto-resume of parent at exact paused phase
resume() method finds PAUSE action to restore phase state
RESUME action emitted with resumedFrom details
Supports nested sessions up to depth 3

name: Backend.API.ExploitExecution
observations: Triggers backdoor on port 21, connects to shell on port 6200
Returns success status, session_id, output, shell_port

name: Backend.Services.VsftpdBackdoorExploit
observations: Trigger: USER backdoor:) on FTP port 21

name: Frontend.Exploit.RealExecution

name: TestEnvironment.Metasploitable2
observations: 23 open ports including vsftpd 2.3.4 on port 21

name: AKIS.SessionTracker.MultiSession
observations: Multi-session support with .akis-sessions.json (all sessions) and .akis-session.json (current session)
Session hierarchy with depth tracking (0=main, 1=child, 2=grandchild, max=3)
Auto-pause parent on child session start with PAUSE action
Auto-resume parent on child complete with RESUME action
Export all sessions to combined workflow log
Reset command clears all sessions after commit
Interrupt detection and recording with INTERRUPT action type
CLI commands: start, phase, detail, file-change, context, decision, delegate, skills, pause, resume, interrupt, complete, reset, export, all-status

name: AKIS.Monitor.VSCodeExtension.ActionTypes
observations: 11 action types with icons: SESSION_START(🚀), PHASE_CHANGE(📍), DECISION(💡), DETAIL(📝), FILE_CHANGE(📄), CONTEXT(📊), DELEGATE(🤝), PAUSE(⏸️), RESUME(▶️), INTERRUPT(⚠️), COMPLETE(✅)
Visual session hierarchy with depth indicators and tree lines
Multi-session view with current session highlighting
Action timeline displays most recent 20 actions
Auto-refresh every 2 seconds for live updates

name: AKIS.Framework.StartupProtocol
observations: Mandatory session state query at every prompt start
Read .akis-session.json to check for active session
If active session exists, continue from current phase
Emit [SESSION: task] @AgentName | phase: PHASE | depth: N
Stale session detection if age > 30min with user prompt
Anti-drift gates: [SESSION] before work → [AKIS] before code → [SCOPE] at PLAN → [ANCHOR] mid-task → [COMPLETE] at end

name: Backend.Services.ExploitMatchService.MetadataEnrichment
observations: Enriches ExploitDB/DB results with metadata from static mappings
Fuzzy title matching for cross-platform exploit identification
Merges exploit_metadata (shell_port, shell_type, payload_variant) into responses
Enables exploit builder to use real configurations instead of generic guessing

name: Frontend.Access.ExploitBuilder.PriorityBasedConfig
observations: Correctly configures vsftpd backdoor: port 6200, bind_shell, bash

name: DevOps.Docker.CacheInvalidation
observations: Browser cache persists after container restart - requires hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R)
Frontend JS files cached despite new build hash (main.*.js)
Complete rebuild protocol: docker-compose down -v → docker system prune → npm build → docker-compose up --build
Volume removal critical for eliminating stale cached data
nginx logs show old code path usage when cache not cleared

name: Backend.API.ExploitExecution.DebuggingPattern
observations: Backend API works via curl but fails in browser = frontend issue
Check nginx logs for API endpoint being called (POST /api/v1/vulnerabilities/exploit/execute)
Absence of expected POST logs = old JavaScript executing (cache issue)
Presence of WebSocket 403 errors = code attempting deprecated endpoint
Backend logs confirm real vs simulated execution paths

name: Frontend.Access.ExploitExecution.BrowserCache
observations: Resolved connection error by clearing browser cache after rebuild
Issue: Browser loaded old main.b426f51a.js instead of new main.fb8b1023.js
Root cause: Browser cached JavaScript despite container restart
Solution: docker-compose down -v + system prune + npm build + hard refresh
Verified fix: Exploit execution successful with root shell on 172.21.0.25:6200

name: AKIS.v2.Framework
observations: Lightweight agent framework: instructions + knowledge + skills
